Articles.Content:
Snow flake? Carbon atom? Tie/bow tie? Flower? Human body? Watch?

Edited February 6, 2015 by stijnovic
Is "nerves" the answer?

A necklace is similar? [Okay, well that gets me nowhere] Let's see... a key, a pendant, a locket, and a carcanet are all similar, but they all lack at specific points. So it's gotta be something different. (Well, a locket actually sounds close. What exactly doesn't work about it?) The first line of verse 2. That's the kicker for me.

So I have to narrow it down to one...

If anything, I'll stick with a Locket, but I bet my right shoe this time it's wrong.

You're right; it's wrong.
Snow flake? Carbon atom? Tie/bow tie? Flower? Human body? Watch?
None of those. XD
Is "nerves" the answer?
Nope, unless you can somehow get the second half of verse 2 to fit with it. Also, I don't think all possible permutations of nerves are equally likely, considering they typically have specific purposes to perform.
Are they strings/threads?
Getting muchÃ¢â‚¬â€¹ closer, but not quite there yet.
Sounds like you're describing hair.

Is it hair?

Edit: @~^$. Beaten to it. OK then, is it wires?
i dont think hair or wires fit. Cantab do you wear wires around your neck?

A beard.

Don't ask me why, that's immediately what I thought of.

A healthy heart? [Mariyate came up with that one]

Edited February 6, 2015 by Xannari Ferrows

Cantab do you wear wires around your neck?
I frequently wear headphones. I think we all do. And indeed, if I want to talk on my mobile while I'm driving then I'm "demanded" by law to use a hands-free kit which could be a wired headphones-like one.

In fact, I'm going to guess, is the riddle specifically headphones?
It's definitely related to hair. Split ends?

Sounds like you're describing hair.
Nope!
Is it hair?

Edit: @~^$. Beaten to it. OK then, is it wires?

Ooooh, pretty close... but nope.
A beard.

Don't ask me why, that's immediately what I thought of.

Nope. xD
A healthy heart? [Mariyate came up with that one]
Nope!
It's definitely related to hair. Split ends?
Hmph. It is not.
I frequently wear headphones. I think we all do. And indeed, if I want to talk on my mobile while I'm driving then I'm "demanded" by law to use a hands-free kit which could be a wired headphones-like one.

In fact, I'm going to guess, is the riddle specifically headphones?

... yes. It's headphones. Well, earphones, anyway. Same deal, right?

Well, that was pretty quick for a vexx riddle.

Not because it was any easier than the others, that is.
Eh, I'm not fussed. I wrote it in maybe 3 minutes or so, so I wasn't expecting it to last too long.

It was a pretty good one. B737 put me onto the answer really by asking "why wires?"

What was "the demanded best" - a mobile handsfree kit like I suspected, or something else?

And I should have one in due course. Hopefully less "anything could fit" than my last, but it's always hard to judge when you're writing.

Oh, that (and the millions of possible forms, etc.) referred to how you always want your wires to be untangled, but they alwaysÃ¢â‚¬â€¹ end up tangled due to there being a small number of "untangled" states they can be in v.s. the large number of "tangled" states they could be in.

I completely didn't read it that way. But we've all been there!

I did learn a trick to stop them tangling though: tie the ends together. A loop can't tangle like a straight string can.
Aye, not as easily... but it can still get tangled
Cantab do you have a riddle for us?

Cantab do you have a riddle for us?

Noooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo! It will be officially spring before anyone gets it.
I don't know about that. I'm up for it.

Well, we'll see how hard it is. This one at least shouldn't be as prone to anything-fits-syndrome as my last.

The title backed up by no tests,

Loved by our teacher nonetheless.

Invented down south in Texas,

For some time now it's been pointless.

It looks like some much better known,

But looks do lie, for it's its own.

Just make a guess! What is the worst,

that could happen? Let's end this verse.
[Oh jesus this will sound stupid] Effort?

Well, we'll see how hard it is. This one at least shouldn't be as prone to anything-fits-syndrome as my last.

The title backed up by no tests,

Loved by our teacher nonetheless.

Invented down south in Texas,

For some time now it's been pointless.

It looks like some much better known,

But looks do lie, for it's its own.

Just make a guess! What is the worst,

that could happen? Let's end this verse.

For some time now it's been pointless... Sounds like something obsolete...

Just make a guess!

Slide Ruler?
